metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7041 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The pam_userdb module for Pam uses a case-insensitive method to comparehashed passwords, which makes it easier for attackers to guess the passwordvia a brute force attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-cracklib - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules-bin - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-runtime - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam0g - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pam package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1').
